definition: nouveau riche/upstart/new appointee
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
expensive/noble/precious/(honorific) your

sentences.english: And then there are ambitious souls looking to marry up with China’s newly well-off.
sentences.chinese: 然后指望和中国新贵结婚的野心家们出现了。

sentences.english: Hong Chengli of recreational industry parvenu discovered her artistic talent.
sentences.chinese: 娱乐业新贵洪承礼发现了她的艺术天分。

sentences.english: He had served so many high-class citizens, the rich, the governors, and the new-rich wannabes.
sentences.chinese: 他侍奉了很多上层人物，富翁，政客，和新贵们。

sentences.english: Be what lets Chen Chacheng be tea bound " parvenu " ?
sentences.chinese: 是什么让陈茶成为茶界“新贵”呢？

sentences.english: A fresh richer is purchasing coffin in a store death.
sentences.chinese: 一名新贵在墓葬品商店选购他死时要用的棺材。

definition: an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
old, well-known brand/old style/old school/an old hand/experienced veteran
person of outstanding talent
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
current favorite/the latest thing/darling (of the market or the media etc)
lit. big crocodile/fig. major figure/big shot/top boss (esp. criminal)
big boss/leader of a group/dominant (position)
despot/tyrant/bully
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
rich and powerful (families)/aristocratic/big shots
well-known figure/excellent (person, company etc)
young guard/young and vigorous group with new ideas/new wave
dark horse/fig. unexpected winner
a powerful chief of the princes of the Spring and Autumn Period (770-476 BC)/overlord/hegemon
